content.question: If <math alttext="a, sub n, equals 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, for all positive integers <math alttext="n" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></math>, what is the value of <math alttext="s sub n" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>S</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, the <math alttext="n" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>n</mi><mtext>th</mtext></mrow></math> partial sum of the infinite series <math alttext="the sum, from n equals 1, to infinity, of a, sub n" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><munderover><mstyle displaystyle="true" mathsize="140%"><mrow><mo>∑</mo></mrow></mstyle><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munderover><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator n, times open parenthesis, n plus 1, close parenthesis, and denominator 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>n</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 10.1: (BC ONLY) Defining Convergent and Divergent Infinite Series

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
